issue.title: Steam does not run when Block Outsider Intrusion into LAN filter is enabled

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Windows ### AdGuard version 7.21.1 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? the problem is with app, not a site ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? Steam app ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, Legitimate URL Shortener, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific IndianList ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? Hide your search queries, Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. The Steam app does not run when `Block Outsider Intrusion into LAN` filter is enabled. 2. Many months ago, it used to cause a long delay to open Steam but back then this filter was not presented as an option in AdGuard for Windows's Add a filter page, so I didn't report back then 3. But now the filter is present in the list and enabling it causes the Steam app not able to run 4. Alternate is to either disable the filter or disable the Filter localhost option in Advanced Settings which would make this filter useless anyway 5. Either it should be fixed if possible, or the filter should be removed from AdGuard for Windows and other affected AdGuard apps. 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
It looks like a Steam problem. I hadn't run Steam for a long time (2-3 months), and before the auto-update, it started up and functioned normally. At the same time, that requests were blocked by this filter.

Please test
`@@||localhost^$domain=steamloopback.host`

issue.title: mail.google.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mail.google.com/mail/u/1/#starred/FMfcgzQbgcPKvKTKQLtQNcxQpRbxznWQ](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmail.google.com%2Fmail%2Fu%2F1%2F%23starred%2FFMfcgzQbgcPKvKTKQLtQNcxQpRbxznWQ) ### Comment > I could not open link from official Google Ads mail to open my Google Ads and download my invoice. No settings or filters were possible to include an exception so I had to turn off whole extension. While I wanted to create personal filter, even if that was possible, it's still not correct behavior. Either make exception for such official sites or invent a better system. We are not talking about ads anymore, we are talking about opening links from official emails from important services. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/5fil8012qroks8cswwo4sg4owgogok8ckyir3lt7lk.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/gzjybfzaz280ss8cgsgs4gs0sswoo8opwhxg1zdcjk.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.127 MV3 System version: | `Windows 11` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base Browsing Security: | enabled Browsing Security statistics: | enabled

comment.body: @Scandre29 Hi. It seems HTTPS filtering by Eset causes it in recent versions. Even our old versions are affected (there haven't been any problems for a long time). We know about this conflict.

comment.body:
> I could not open link from official Google Ads mail to open my Google Ads and download my invoice. No settings or filters were possible to include an exception so I had to turn off whole extension. While I wanted to create personal filter, even if that was possible, it's still not correct behavior. Either make exception for such official sites or invent a better system. We are not talking about ads anymore, we are talking about opening links from official emails from important services.

We need example of the link. Also please reproduce thhe problem when filtering log is opened, and export it. Then attach here as ZIP.

issue.title: www.nicovideo.jp

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.nicovideo.jp/search/アクアリウム?rf=nvpc&rp=ranking_custom&ra=web_header](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nicovideo.jp%2Fsearch%2F%E3%82%A2%E3%82%AF%E3%82%A2%E3%83%AA%E3%82%A6%E3%83%A0%3Frf%3Dnvpc%26rp%3Dranking_custom%26ra%3Dweb_header) ### Comment > 拡張機能「Tampermonkey 」のUserScript「MylistPocket」が正常に機能しなくなる。 > MylistPocketの処理（Popup？）がブロックされたことで発生していると思われる。 ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/fy08cadkvj4kocccg8gsgws0s4kcg0s7c1ya071icg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/l3yygm5f4y8cowwkkgw4w004csg4wswnehml2cfi1c.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/rc5zk1goc1csoc88k0ww0c08wk04wwk3klb5r0bs4g.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.102 MV2 System version: | `Windows 11` Browser: | Edge Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (2880) Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Language-specific:
AdGuard Japanese Browsing Security: | disabled Browsing Security statistics: | disabled
